meanings.definition: The state or quality of being drunk or intoxicated.
meanings.sent1: After consuming too much alcohol, his insobrieties were evident to everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The insobrieties of the man led to his inability to walk straight.
meanings.sent3: His insobrieties at the wedding made him the center of attention on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The insobrieties of the situation were like a fog clouding his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The insobrieties of the night lingered in his memory the next morning.

meanings.definition: Lack of sobriety or moderation in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her insobrieties in conversation often led to misunderstandings with others.
meanings.sent2: The insobrieties of his actions caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent3: The insobrieties of the children's game made it more fun for everyone involved.
meanings.sent4: The insobrieties of his thoughts were like a rollercoaster ride in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The insobrieties of her behavior left a lasting impression on her friends.
